title: Which pens are best for writing Chinese calligraphy? - Quora

response.answer_text: All the answers are excellent. However, if you are asking about a pen, not a brush, and you want to do calligraphy vs. just writing, then I recommend you buy either a brush-pen, or felt-tip marker with a brush tip. My first preference for doing Chinese is calligraphy is to use a traditional Chinese calligraphy brush:  To use a calligraphy brush, you will need to carry with you either a bottle of liquid ink, or a stick of solid ink that you can grind into liquid form each time you want to write. For myself, this is the only tool I would ever use for doing true calligraphy. However, this isn’t everyone’s preference. Sometimes you want to carry something with you that is more readily available for use. Option two is a brush-pen:  There is quite a range of choices of brush-pens. The best have natural hair and act very much like a traditional brush. There are also synthetic-fibre brush pens and a choice of firm, medium or soft. I recommend this very comprehensive guide to brush-pens: Guide to Choosing a Brush Pen for Calligraphy You can see a bunch of examples here: Brush Pen, Brush Pen Suppliers and Manufacturers at Alibaba.com Many stores in China should carry them. Finally, there is the handy brush-tipped marker. This is a synthetic fibre simulated brush tip similar to a standard felt-tipped marker. In terms of absolute ease of use, these are very handy. Drop one in your purse or bag and take it out whenever needed. You won’t need to worry about refilling it or the ink spilling out or leaking. If you know what you are doing, you can get fairly good calligraphy results. But make no mistake: this is not a replacement for an actual calligraphy brush! If you want to use a marker, I recommend the ones made in Japan. They are very high quality, inexpensive, and have a longer tip than similar brush style markers made in Europe. Of the non-Japanese manufacturers I recommend markers made by Staedtler for the both the quality of the fibre tips and the ink colours. Brush, ink, paper and instone , called the Four Treasures of the Study, are the key instruments for writing Chinese calligraphy.  1.Writing brush  Writing brush ranks the first of the four treasures of the study.Traditional writing brushes are not only the necessary stationary of ancient Chinese, but also have extraordinary charm in expressing Chinese calligraphy and painting. There are many kinds of writing brushes. In terms of the materials, many animals’hair are used such as rabbits, goats, deer, mice, tigers, gorillas, ducks, geese, chicken, pigs even humans.From the performance’s perspective, writing brushes can be classified into rigidity brush, flexible brush and doubled both brush. As for the material of barrel, different varieties of bamboos and wood.The most famous writing brush producing area in China is Huzhou City, Zhejiang Province. Writing brushes made in Huzhou is called Hu writing brush. 2.Ink  Ink is the pigment for writing and drawing. It is divided into two types: pine-soot ink and oil-soot ink. Pint-soot ink is made of pine wood’s ash. The characteristics of it are black, low glossiness, light colloid, so it is only suitable for writing. While the oil-soot ink is made from animal or plant oil. It usually has bright color and is perfect for traditional Chinese painting. Today, Tunxi District and Xi County in Huangshan city, Anhui Province are the two manufacturing centers of Hui Ink Sticks. 3.Paper  Paper is one of the four great inventions in ancient China.People believe that the Xuan Paper is the best paper to write . Xuan Paper is produced in Jin County, Anhui Province, which is a kind of high class artistic paper used for traditional Chinese brush calligraphy, painting, mounting, rubbing, watermarking etc. Till now, Xuan Paper has a history of over one thousand years. Xuan Paper has excellent ink embellishment, durability, non-deformation and insect resistance, thus it has become the paper which could best present the artistic style of traditional Chinese calligraphy. 4.Inkstone  Inkstone are the container of ink. Most of inkstones are made of stones. Inkstone have various shapes including rectangular, square, circle, oval and bionic shapes such as animals and plants. High class inkstones have the characteristics of exquisit smooth and quality, grinded ink is fine and well-distributed.
